channel.title: AP News - US News
channel.description: Top US News stories from AP News

item.title: An estimated 290 residences damaged by flooding from lake dammed by Alaska glacier, officials say
item.description: Officials in Alaska’s capital city say roughly 290 residences were damaged last week by flooding from a lake dammed by the Mendenhall Glacier.

item.title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. can remain on the North Carolina presidential ballot, judge says
item.description: A judge has ruled that Robert F. Kennedy Jr. can remain on North Carolina’s presidential ballots. Superior Court Judge Keith Gregory rejected the preliminary injunction request by the North Carolina Democratic Party.

item.title: An earthquake with a magnitude of 4.6 has struck the Los Angeles area, the USGS says
item.description: An earthquake with a magnitude of 4.6 has struck the Los Angeles area. The U.S. Geological Survey said Monday that it was centered near the city’s Highland Park neighborhood, about 7.5 miles (12.1 kilometers) below the surface.
